manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Tea Tree Body Bar The best wake-up call for weary skin, bar none. Enriched with exfoliating parsley flakes and invigorating tea tree oil, this richly lathering bar soap cleans, exfoliates and helps all skin types feel fresh. The invigorating aroma of mint, eucalyptus, lavender and rosemary provides a fresh, clean feel. Added bonus: It’s excellent for shaving!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Smells great, and lathers well. Great for use during the cold winter months. Longevity is not the best, and it is pricey.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great clean smell!
reviews.reviewText: I give this as gifts to my grandsons who hardly ever bath! They’re young and and apparently don’t think they stink! I also provide them with a shampoo with the same smell! It’s wonderful! Also —- my sister had bad itchy sores over a large part of her body and this soap took care of the itching and healed some of the sores . We do t know why it didn’t heal them all but we were still impressed!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SMOOTH, CLEAN SKIN
reviews.reviewText: HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Especially if you are someone with dry skin or work in a dirty environment. This bar works so well! I bought it along with the exfoliating scrub pouch and every shower is a spa treatment. My skin has never been so smooth and the smell is very nice. As a bonus it also helps aith Athlete's Foot. I'm thinking about stocking up and never going back to body wash again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I just got this in Monday, I ordered it on Sat, wasn't expecting it until Wed. So that is awesome, keep up the good work amazon.I cannot speak on it to much as I just started using it, though so far it's nice. I can say, from using other soaps, to this one...its different. It's going great, feels moisturizing, leaves me all tingly. Once it's rinsed off, it's just that, gone. My skin doesn't feel any drier, but I can say it's feels hydrated either?! I smell good, feel good so it's doing what it's supposed to, lol. I'll see how it is after the first week, maybe month just be sure. I bought this in hopes of clearing up some random acne that popped up on my back and on my body, as well as be good to my skin. Nothing has disappeared overnight, but I can say it's definitely clearing up. I am also VERY glad it's not overly minty scented, nothing against peppermint, just don't want to be overwhelmed by it. I do like the scent of this soap, mild, earthy and lifts my mood everytime I take a shower.Late update:I used this for a month and was pleased. It didn't clear my skin up sadly, it did help tame it so I am blaming hormones or blisters from sunburn. Either way, this calmed my skin down considerably, definitely helped with BO, working out, eating crazy..I'll just leave it there, lol.The one downside I will say is the soap residue that left over. From this and my shampoo and conditioner bars, was CRAZY! So do try it out, you won't be too disappointed, but also beware of soap scum build up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: And cleans well. This is not a moisturizing soap. More for like your feet

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s better than I thought.
reviews.reviewText: The smell is incredible. It lathers so well and I feel the tea tree tingling. It doesn’t dry out my skin!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This soap works. Good if you have a hairy body it cleans and softens hair an cool skin down I recommend buying Paul Mitchell’s tea, tree, shampoo and conditioner as well. Use all three and you won’t be smelling bad.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024

reviews.reviewTitle: I would die if without this PM hand soap.
reviews.reviewText: This soap washes my whole body including my hair. Any oily residue is squeaky clean afterwards. This soap is very hard to find. I’ve used it for at least ten years and use nothing else. It would break my heart if I could not find it any longer, so I buy extra. You don’t have to use much, it works that good and smells subtle but oh so good. Highly, highly recommended this bar of soap from Paul Mitchell tea tree line. I use the shampoo in this line too. It won’t dry out your skin either. Best wishes.
È un buon prodotto, buono l’odore e sicuramente rinfrescante

reviews.reviewTitle: Super flauschiger Schaum und (fast) nur natürliche Inhaltsstoffe
reviews.reviewText: Seifen zur Körperpflege verwende ich schon lange. Ich mag das angenehm saubere und reine Gefühl, welches sie auf der haut hinterlassen. Rückfettendes Duschgel hinterlässt dagegen bei mir immer ein Gefühl, was ich nicht mag.Bei der Seife von Paul Mitchell handelt es sich um ein 150 Gramm schweres Stück. Das sind 50 % als bei vielen anderen Seifen. Dies relativiert ein wenig den doch sehr hohen Preis.Das erste, was mich an dieser Seife begeistert, ist das wunderbare Schaumvermögen. Der Schaum ist sehr weich und fein. Der zweite wichtige Punkt: Der Glyceringehalt (entsteht natürlicherweise bei der Verseifung von Fetten und Ölen) scheint sehr hoch zu sein. Jedenfalls war nach meinem Empfinden bisher noch keine von mir genutzte Seife derart hautpflegend und angenehm. Wirklich phantastisch!Der Duft ist ebenfalls beeindruckend. Man riecht und spürt die leicht kühlende Minze. Aber auch Rosmarin und Teebaum sind zu riechen. Insgesamt ergibt sich ein nicht zu schwerer männlicher Geruch.Die Inhaltsstoffe sind für ein Produkt einer großen Kette ebenfalls toll. Neben Palm- und Kokosöl finden sich acht verschiedene Kräuter- und Pflanzenextrakte in dieser Seife.Ja, geringe Mengen EDTA sind ebenfalls enthalten und verbessern das Schaumvermögen und verringern die Kalkseifenbildung. Wer EDTA nicht nutzen möchte, für den ist diese Seife leider nichts. Aber dies kann jeder selbst entscheiden. EDTA ist ein zugelassener kosmetischer Inhaltsstoff.Fazit: Super toller Duft, hervorragend hautpflegend. Mit einer Ausnahme nur natürliche Inhaltsstoffe, wie man sie in einer Seife erwartet. Für mich sind das fünf Sterne. Einzig der Preis ist arg hoch, dafür gibt es aber auch eine Seife mit 150 Gramm.

Producto original, bien empaquetado y sin ningún tipo de incidencia. Contenta con la compra. Recomendable para limpieza de barbas y cuerpo. Te deja la piel super limpia, aunque algo seca, nada que una crema hidratante no pueda compensar. Repetiré.
